children: A 51-year-old man is evaluated for syncope after prolonged standing in a warm environment.
Which of the following ECG findings is shown?

First-degree atrioventricular block is characterized by a prolonged PR interval (â‰¥200 ms), as seen on this patient's ECG. It is usually a benign condition and does not require intervention. It is most commonly secondary to medications that slow atrioventricular node conduction, degeneration of the node, infiltrative cardiomyopathies, or, as in this case, high vagal tone.
